reasoning: Bronchial hyperreactivity is a pathophysiological state rather than a discrete disease entity. Prevalence in general population estimated at 10-16% based on methacholine/histamine challenge tests. Using midpoint of 13% (13,000 per 100k). Confidence is lower due to lack of clinical disease definition and reliance on functional testing rather than diagnosed disease.
source: Epidemiology of bronchial hyperresponsiveness literature review based on community-based surveys
